Core Module API

The repo_sapiens.core module provides foundational functionality.

Module Reference

Core functionality for hello-python-test package.

repo_sapiens.core.greet(name: str | None = None) → None[source]

Print a greeting message.

Parameters:

name – Optional name to greet. Defaults to “World” if not provided.

Examples

>>> greet()
Hello, World!
>>> greet("Python")
Hello, Python!
repo_sapiens.core.get_greeting(name: str = 'World') → str[source]

Generate a greeting message string.

Parameters:

name – The name to include in the greeting. Defaults to “World”.

Returns:

A greeting message string.

Examples

>>> get_greeting()
'Hello, World!'
>>> get_greeting("Python")
'Hello, Python!'

Functions

greet

repo_sapiens.core.greet(name: str | None = None) → None[source]

Print a greeting message.

Parameters:

name – Optional name to greet. Defaults to “World” if not provided.

Examples

>>> greet()
Hello, World!
>>> greet("Python")
Hello, Python!

Print a greeting message to stdout.

Parameters:

  • name (str, optional): The name to include in the greeting. If not provided, defaults to “World”.

Returns:

  • None

Example:

from repo_sapiens import greet

greet()  # Output: Hello, World!
greet("Alice")  # Output: Hello, Alice!

get_greeting

repo_sapiens.core.get_greeting(name: str = 'World') → str[source]

Generate a greeting message string.

Parameters:

name – The name to include in the greeting. Defaults to “World”.

Returns:

A greeting message string.

Examples

>>> get_greeting()
'Hello, World!'
>>> get_greeting("Python")
'Hello, Python!'

Generate a greeting message as a string.

Parameters:

  • name (str): The name to include in the greeting. Defaults to “World”.

Returns:

  • str: The greeting message.

Example:

from repo_sapiens import get_greeting

msg = get_greeting()  # Returns: "Hello, World!"
msg = get_greeting("Bob")  # Returns: "Hello, Bob!"

Full Module Documentation

Core functionality for hello-python-test package.

repo_sapiens.core.greet(name: str | None = None) → None[source]

Print a greeting message.

Parameters:

name – Optional name to greet. Defaults to “World” if not provided.

Examples

>>> greet()
Hello, World!
>>> greet("Python")
Hello, Python!
repo_sapiens.core.get_greeting(name: str = 'World') → str[source]

Generate a greeting message string.

Parameters:

name – The name to include in the greeting. Defaults to “World”.

Returns:

A greeting message string.

Examples

>>> get_greeting()
'Hello, World!'
>>> get_greeting("Python")
'Hello, Python!'

Type Hints

All functions are fully type-hinted for IDE support:

from typing import Optional

def greet(name: Optional[str] = None) -> None: ...
def get_greeting(name: str = "World") -> str: ...
